name: Gaurank Maheshwari
title: Machine Learning / AI Engineer
summary: Machine Learning / AI Engineer with 2+ years of experience specializing in LLM inference optimization, GPU acceleration, and low-latency model deployment. AAAI-26 Spotlight Author (Top 11%) and NSF Trainee focused on building production-grade, efficient systems (CUDA, TensorRT, vLLM). Pursuing M.S. in Data Science at RIT (Dec 2025). STEM OPT eligible.

education.degree: Master of Science in Data Science

education.institution: The LNM Institute of Information Technology (LNMIIT)
education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science

current_role.title: Automation Engineer
current_role.summary: Migrated 6+ internal workflows to unified database systems using Python + SQL ETL pipelines, improving data reliability and enabling real-time reporting across incubator operations.

research.focus: Transparent, multimodal ML and human-centered AI
highlights: Optimized multimodal signal pipelines (EEG, EMG, ECG, motion capture) in PyTorch with CUDA (Python); reduced inference latency by ~30%, enabling near real-time deployment in human–robot collaboration (HRC) tasks.
Benchmarked and accelerated ML inference with TensorRT vs. PyTorch baselines; improved throughput by ~1.5× and validated deployment on UR-10 and Sawyer robots for synchronized HRC experiments.

work_experience.title: AI Engineer
highlights: Designed LangChain multi-agent pipelines for podcast transcription (Deepgram ASR, Hugging Face, GPT); improved token usage to cut inference cost by ~35% and achieve ~86% speaker attribution accuracy on 20k+ episodes (~50k hrs).
Engineered FastAPI APIs powering the MVP, deployed via AWS + GitLab CI/CD; added latency and cost monitoring that reduced iteration cycles by ~20%.

work_experience.title: Applied Research Engineer
work_experience.company: AWARE-AI NSF Research Traineeship Program, RIT
highlights: Optimized multimodal signal pipelines (EEG, EMG, ECG, motion capture) in PyTorch with CUDA (Python); reduced inference latency by ~30%, enabling near real-time deployment in human–robot collaboration (HRC) tasks.
Benchmarked and accelerated ML inference with TensorRT vs. PyTorch baselines; improved throughput by ~1.5× and validated deployment on UR-10 and Sawyer robots for synchronized HRC experiments.

work_experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer
highlights: Built ML-driven scarcity and drop-timing models using Python/SQL, pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn; applied feature engineering to optimize transaction data, boosting launch engagement by ~18%.

Revamped statistical valuation models for 600+ digital assets; automated release-timing recommendations and dashboards, improving market value perception of NFT assets by ~10% and strengthening early-stage trading liquidity.

projects.name: LLM Inference Lab: Research-grade Speculative Decoding Runtime
projects.description: Developed PyTorch + CUDA/MPS runtime with custom kernels, KV-cache reuse, batching, and CUDA Graphs, delivering ~2× GPU throughput, full reproducibility, and deterministic profiling; extended with multi-GPU optimizations.

projects.name: CUDA Graph Routing: GPU-Accelerated Shortest Path on NYC Road Network
projects.description: Designed a CUDA-parallelized Dijkstra's algorithm on a 11.7M-node, 25.3M-edge graph using CSR layout and optimized SSSP kernels, achieving ~1.8× CPU speedup with memory-efficient loaders and scalable validation tools.

projects.name: NewsLensAI: NER-Guided Summarization for Mitigating Hallucination and Bias in LLM-Based News Summaries
projects.description: Capstone project accepted to AAAI 2026 (Student Abstract). Selected for spotlight 3-minute oral presentation and nominated for Best Abstract Competition. Reduced hallucinations in AI-generated news summaries using Gemini, GPT-3.5, and Hugging Face NER; established a bias-detection metric pipeline.

honors_awards.title: AAAI-26 Spotlight (Top 11%)
honors_awards.description: NewsLensAI · Selected for Oral + Best Abstract shortlist; awarded travel funding from NSF AWARE-AI and RIT Graduate School to present in Singapore.

honors_awards.title: NSF AWARE-AI Research Trainee
honors_awards.description: 2024–25: Focus on transparent, multimodal ML and human-centered AI at RIT.

strengths: Results-driven engineer with proven track record of delivering production-grade ML systems with measurable performance improvements (35% cost reduction, 2× throughput gains)
Strong technical communicator who bridges research and product development, translating complex ML concepts into actionable business solutions
Collaborative team player with experience working in fast-paced startup environments and cross-functional research teams
Production-focused mindset: designs for scalability, observability, and maintainability from day one
Continuous learner with expertise spanning LLM optimization, GPU acceleration, and MLOps—stays current with cutting-edge research and industry best practices
Data-driven decision maker: uses metrics and profiling to guide optimization efforts and validate improvements
growth_areas: Actively working on balancing thoroughness with speed-to-market in early-stage product development
Developing stronger stakeholder management skills for aligning technical decisions with business priorities
Enhancing project scoping abilities to better estimate timelines and manage expectations

fun_facts: Avid traveler who enjoys exploring new places and cultures, from spontaneous road trips to structured adventure itineraries.
Former competitive athlete who applies lessons in discipline, strategy, and teamwork from sports to collaborative engineering projects.
Enjoys cooking and experimenting with fusion cuisine, finding it a creative outlet that complements technical problem-solving.
Tech enthusiast who follows the latest developments in AI research and enjoys reading papers from top-tier conferences like NeurIPS, ICML, and AAAI.
Believes in continuous learning and often contributes to open-source projects, particularly in the ML/AI space.
Enjoys balancing technical work with creative pursuits, finding that diverse interests enhance problem-solving approaches.
